Bryan Jordan (15) OF/IF  - 

Awards &

2010 Summit League Winter/Spring

data.text:
Awards & Recognition

2010 Summit League Winter/Spring Academic All-League Selection

2011 Summit League Player of the Week - March 28

2011 All-League Second Team Selection - Second Base

2011 Summit League Winter/Spring Academic All-League Selection

Named to the 2010-11 Summit League Commissioner's List of Academic Excellence

2011 (SENIOR): Hit .286 on the season... hit a home run in the first game of the season at Samford... started 49 games... smacked a three-run home run vs. Iowa at Modern Woodmen Park... collected three hits at Southern Utah on April 29th... hit .533 during the IPFW series including five RBI and 11 total bases... since April 20 has increased batting average from .231 to .290... drew four walks against Illinois State on May 17.

2010 (JUNIOR): Led the team with nine home runs on the season.. finished third on the team in RBI (35) and doubles (18)... is tied for fifth in school history for doubles in a single-season...scored 51 runs to rank fourth on the all-time single-season Top 10 list... scored a run in nine of the team's last 10 games, including four multi-run games... scored a career-high four runs against Furman (2/28)... also drove in four runs in the performance and hit his first career homer... posted eight multi-RBI games on the year... recorded a hit in 42 of 53 games, including 19 multi-hit games... finished the season ranked eighth in The Summit League in doubles, eighth in runs scored and 10th in home runs... drew 28 walks while striking out just 26 times... one of two players to start all 53 games during the season.

AT BLACK HAWK COLLEGE: Selected First Team All-Conference, All-Region and All-District following his sophomore year... earned Academic All-America honors... batted .484 his final year with 18 doubles and eight home runs... set a Black Hawk record with 68 RBI.

HIGH SCHOOL: Lettered two years in baseball and once in basketball... played baseball for coach Chuck Laumann... twice earned Second Team All-Conference honors... recorded a .360 batting average... earned high academic honors, finishing in the top 10 percent of his graduating class with a 3.8 cumulative GPA.

PERSONAL: Son of Robert and Cindy Jordan... born November 17, 1988 in Camarillo, California... was high school teammate with current Leatherneck Jared Depenbrock... favorite professional teams are Cincinnati Reds and Bengals.

MAJOR: Business Management

Career Statistics
